alert.note: Alert for Pickens; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:01PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Tuscaloosa and northeastern Pickens Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 401 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Gordo. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordo, Lubbub, Moores Bridge and Echola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
